meanings.definition: To acknowledge as true or valid; admit
meanings.sent1: I will conceder that you were right about the answer.
meanings.sent2: She decided to conceder her mistake and apologize.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat finally had to conceder that the mouse was too quick.
meanings.sent4: After hours of debate, they had to conceder defeat and accept the outcome.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to conceder the new information carefully.

meanings.sent1: He will conceder the request for an extension on the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to conceder the proposal for a new project.
meanings.sent3: The tree had to conceder to the strong winds during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The riverbank slowly began to conceder to the force of the rushing water.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to conceder to the opponent's superior skill.

meanings.sent1: The conceder of the match graciously congratulated the winner.
meanings.sent2: As a conceder, she always knew when to admit defeat.
meanings.sent3: The conceder of the argument smiled and shook hands with the opponent.
meanings.sent4: In the negotiation, the conceder made sure both parties reached a fair agreement.
meanings.sent5: The conceder's honesty and fairness earned respect from everyone.
